#!/bin/bash
PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin

threshold_seconds=$KMVAR_local_OldestTimeSeconds

tempfile=$(mktemp)

newer=0

while read line; do
 if [ $newer -eq 1 ]; then
    echo "$line" >> "$tempfile"
    ((log_cnt++))

  else
    line_time_str=${line:0:19}
    line_time_seconds=$(date -j -f "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S" "$line_time_str" "+%s")

    if [ "$line_time_seconds" -ge "$threshold_seconds" ]; then
      newer=1
      echo "$line" > "$tempfile"
      ((log_cnt++))
    fi
  fi
done < "$KMVAR_local_LogPath"
 
mv "$tempfile" "$KMVAR_local_LogPath"

echo $log_cnt

#!/bin/bash
PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin

input_string="$KMVAR_local_OldestTimeString"

if [[ ${#input_string} -eq 10 ]]; then
  # Input string has length 10 (yyyy-MM-dd)
  formatted_time="${input_string} 00:00:00"

elif [[ ${#input_string} -eq 16 ]]; then
  # Input string has length 16 (yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm)
  formatted_time="${input_string}:00"

elif [[ ${#input_string} -eq 19 ]]; then
  # Input string has length 19 (yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss), no change needed
  formatted_time="$input_string"

else
  echo "Invalid input: Unsupported time format"
  exit 1

fi

time_format="%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S"
time_seconds=$(date -j -f "$time_format" "$formatted_time" "+%s")

echo $time_seconds

Actions.ActionName: Get Engine.log Record Count and Failures and Timeouts

Actions.Text:
#!/bin/bash
PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin

tempfileFailuresAndTimeouts=$(mktemp)

# Extract failure/timeout lines and write to a temporary file and return the failure/timeout count
failures_and_timeouts_cnt=$(tail -n $KMVAR_local_LogTailCount "$KMVAR_local_LogPath" | grep -E "Action \d+ failed:|timeout" | tee "$tempfileFailuresAndTimeouts" | wc -l)

echo $failures_and_timeouts_cnt $tempfileFailuresAndTimeouts

Actions.ActionName: For the specifed ErrorIndex extract the Engine Log Failure|Timeout line & update the local_ErrorLines

Actions.Text:
#!/bin/bash
PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin

# Return the log file line with the Failure|Timeout specified (via local_ErrorIndex)

tail_of_errors=$(cat "$KMVAR_local_TempFileFailuresAndTimeouts" | tail -n $KMVAR_local_ErrorIndex)

tail_cnt=$(echo "$tail_of_errors" | wc -l)

if [ $tail_cnt -lt $KMVAR_local_ErrorIndex ]; then
	echo ""
else
	echo "$tail_of_errors" | head -n 1
fi

Actions.Text:
try
tell application "System Events"	tell application process "Keyboard Maestro Engine"		tell (first window whose name is "Keyboard Maestro - Display Text")			tell (first button whose role description is "close button")				perform action "AXPress"			end tell		end tell	end tellend tell
on error
end try

%Variable%local_InvisibleSeparator%
>  To backup or advance through the failures and timeouts, click Previous or Next, respectively. When clicking the Previous, Next, or Latest button hold down the Control key (⌃) to toggle the display of the Time, Action, and Description variables.
>  If the hot key trigger includes the Shift key (⇧), the failure or timeout number will start with the one last viewed when the macro previously ran.
>  To return to the latest error, click Latest. When clicking, hold down the Command key (⌘) to select from the most recent Failures|Timeouts. Hold down the Option key (⌥) to reverse the selection order.
>  To view the offending action in the Keyboard Maestro editor, click Action.
>  To open the Keyboard Maestro Engine.log in the Console.app (with this entry selected), click Console. When clicking, hold down the Command key (⌘) to copy the log entries and open in a text editor. Hold down the Option key (⌥) to reverse the order.
>  To delete some (or all) entries in the Keyboard Maestro Engine.log via several reduction methods, click Reduce. When clicking, hold down the Command key (⌘) to Trash the Engine.log.
>  To reveal additional options (e.g., save the displayed Failure|Timeout to the Clipboard), hold down the Command key (⌘) when clicking Done.

ThenActions.Text:
#!/bin/bash
PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin

descending=$KMVAR_local_DescendingEntries

truncated_FailuresAndTimeouts_max95=$(echo "$KMVAR_local_FailuresAndTimeouts" | tail -n 95 | cut -c -120)

input=$truncated_FailuresAndTimeouts_max95

IFS=$'\n' read -rd '' -a input_lines <<<"$input"

cnt=${#input_lines[@]}

output=""

for ((i=0; i<cnt; i++)); do
    line=${input_lines[i]//_/\\_}    
    output+="$((cnt-i))__${line}\n"
done

if [ "$descending" = "1" ]; then
  echo -e "$output" | tac
else
  echo -e "$output"
fi

ThenActions.Text: local_DescendingIsDefault
/tmp/_%ExecutingMacro%

#!/bin/bash
PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin

descending=$KMVAR_local_DescendingEntries

root_path="$KMVAR_local_RootPath"
time_string=$(date +"%Y-%m-%d_%H%M%S")
out_path=${root_path}_${time_string}.txt

if [ "$descending" = "1" ]; then
  tail -n $KMVAR_local_TextEditorLogEntriesCnt "$KMVAR_local_LogPath" | tac > "$out_path"
else
  tail -n $KMVAR_local_TextEditorLogEntriesCnt "$KMVAR_local_LogPath" > "$out_path"
fi

echo "$out_path"

ElseActions.Text:
delete__delete  ⇨ delete Engine.log
purge__purge:RegEx ⇨ modify Engine.log, retaining all entries except those that match the RegEx
keep__keep:RegEx ⇨ modify Engine.log, retaining all entries that match the RegEx
tail__tail:n ⇨ modify Engine.log, retaining only the latest n entries
today__today ⇨ modify Engine.log, retaining only entries since midnight
days__days:n  ⇨ modify Engine.log, retaining only the latest n days of entries (e.g., days:2 == since midnight yesterday)
time__time:YYYY-MM-DD [hh:mm[:ss]] ⇨ modify Engine.log, retaining only records since the specified date/time

Actions.Text:
__👉🏿 Select a method to delete some (or all) of the entries in the Engine.log
__👉🏿 In all cases, a copy of the unmodified Engine.log can be recovered from the Trash
__👉🏿 A summary message will appear after the change is made –or– ⌘:𝗕𝘆𝗽𝗮𝘀𝘀
%Variable%local_Methods%

clipboard_last__Save the Last Displayed Failure|Timeout to the Clipboard
tail__tail -F Engine.log
reveal__Reveal the Engine.log in the Finder
test__Run ‘%ExecutingMacro%’ in Test Mode
cancel__Cancel Macro

ThenActions.Text:
clipboard_last__Save the Last Displayed Failure|Timeout to the Clipboard
clipboard_all_ascending__Save the %Variable%local_ErrorLineCnt% Displayed Failures|Timeouts to the Clipboard
clipboard_all_descending__Save the %Variable%local_ErrorLineCnt% Displayed Failures|Timeouts to the Clipboard (descending)
reveal__Reveal the Engine.log in the Finder
test__Run ‘%ExecutingMacro%’ in Test Mode
cancel__Cancel Macro
%Variable%local_PwlSelection%

Actions.Text: ### Requires Keyboard Maestro 8.0.3+ ###set kmInst to system attribute "KMINSTANCE"tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine"	set kmLogPath to getvariable "local_LogPath" instance kmInstend telltell application "Terminal"	do script "clear; tail -F " & quoted form of kmLogPathend tell
